intro: Linaria kneuckeri, commonly known as the Kneucker's toadflax, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of yellow-orange flowers. The plant produces small, linear leaves and has a delicate appearance, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine settings. Linaria kneuckeri thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, typically growing in rocky or sandy habitats. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
